modularity.events

Class Event

  • java.lang.Object
    • modularity.events.Event

  • public abstract class Event
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to register reactions to events and call them when a new event is created.
    Author:
    Alexander Otto

    • Constructor Detail

      • Event

        public Event()
        Constructor of the class Event. MUST be called if the constructor is overwritten! Requires _joinTimer to be positive. This value must be positive. A value of 0 can result in an infinite waiting-time. If the reactions don't finish in time a new ErrorEvent is created. If the constructor isn't overwritten the default-value fulfills this criteria.

    • Method Detail

      • registerReaction

        public static final boolean registerReaction(java.lang.String pKey,
                                             modularity.Reaction pReact)
        Register reaction. TODO comment
        Parameters:
        pKey - the key
        pReact - the react
        Returns:
        true, if successful

      • registerReaction

        public static final boolean registerReaction(java.lang.String pKey,
                                             modularity.Reaction pReact,
                                             int pOrder)
        Registers a reaction that will be executed once this event occurs. If the key is already used it will not be registered. Requires pKey != null. Requires pReact != null. Requires pOrder == -1 || pOrder == 0 || pOrder == 1.
        Parameters:
        pKey - a string-identifier for the reaction. Must be unique from all other registered reactions.
        pReact - a reaction that is executed once this event occurs
        pOrder - if -1 then the reaction is executed before normal reactions, if 0 it is executed normally and if 1 it is executed after normal reactions.
        Returns:
        true if the key was unique and the reaction was sucessfully registered. else false.

      • removeReaction

        public static final void removeReaction(java.lang.String pKey)
        Removes a reaction from this event. Requires pKey != null.
        Parameters:
        pKey - the key of the reaction that should be removed

      • getTimeFired

        public final java.time.Instant getTimeFired()
        Returns the instant this event was fired.
        Returns:
        the instant this event was fired.

      • run

        public final void run()
        Starts the event.

      • waitForCompletion

        public final void waitForCompletion()
        pauses the current thread until the event is completely processed. Can create an ErrorEvent if it is interrupted.
